explanation: to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
lit. love the house and its crow (idiom); involvement with sb and everyone connected; Love me, love my dog.
to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom); fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop; cf. 十年樹木 ，十年树木 ，百年树人
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom); to be undaunted by repeated setbacks; to be indomitable
to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
all-embracing; all-inclusive
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors; to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming); to aggravate; to intensify
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality; to adopt an original approach
guests feel at home (in a hotel, guest house etc); a home away from home
not feel ashamed to ask and learn from one's subordinates
(of a rumor etc) to collapse (in the light of facts etc); to be discredited
incurable; incorrigible; beyond cure; hopeless
inconceivable (idiom); unimaginable; unfathomable
to reap without sowing (idiom)
not to engage in honest work; to ignore one's proper occupation; not to attend to one's proper duties
to lose consciousness; unconscious; in a coma
to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to disappear without trace; to vanish all of a sudden; to spread fast; to spread like wildfire
by fair means or foul; by hook or by crook; unscrupulously
to overestimate one's capabilities
year in, year out (idiom); (over) many years
to loot a burning house; to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to follow the track of an overturned cart; to repeat a disastrous policy
with a worried frown
to excel the common (idiom); surpassing; preeminent; outstanding
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious; nitpick
to drool (over) (idiom); to yearn for; to covet; to crave
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
calm; unruffled
readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
no time to deal with it (idiom); caught unprepared
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake; to inadvertently alert an enemy; to punish sb as a warning to others (idiom)
bold and decisive
selfless; impartial
to boast shamelessly; to talk big
to make prompt decisions (idiom)
gossip; hearsay; rumor
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains; give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through; without high ambitions, but getting by
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure; beside oneself with joy
a person of virtue and prestige; a person of good moral standing and reputation
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom); fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience; to cast pearls before swine; caviar to the general; to preach to deaf ears; to talk over sb's head
to be influenced
to develop and promote; to carry forward; to bring to great height of development
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom); to skip one's sleep and meals; to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers; regardless of perils
fast as lightning
to carry out official duties and observe the law
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom); fig. few and far between
to skimp on the job; to work half-heartedly; not to take the job seriously
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view; acute foresight
to sleep peacefully (idiom); (fig.) to rest easy; to be free of worries
to watch the fires burning across the river; to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
each has its own merits (idiom)
deep-rooted (problem etc)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful; to fail through lack of a final effort; to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom); (in palace construction) elaborate and refined
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself; taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
ignorant and inexperienced; ill-informed and narrow-minded
It's hard to clap with only one hand.; It takes two to tango; It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
to stake all on one throw
to angle for fame (idiom); to fish for compliments
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom); fig. to speak in a roundabout way; to equivocate; to beat about the bush
(of a person) honorable; not devious; (of a behavior) fair and aboveboard; without tricks; openly; (of a situation) out in the open
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
look for a needle in the ocean, see 大海捞针
to suffer every possible torment (idiom); bitter hardship; to bear one's cross
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom); to aim too high
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom); to let one's imagination run wild
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words; cheating wheedling; dishonest rhetoric
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch; the crucial point that brings the subject to life; a few words to clinch the point
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous; to overdo it
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom); fig. to spend money like water; extravagant
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain; also written 浑水摸鱼
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom); fig. great commotion; pandemonium
collecting opinions is of wide benefit (idiom); to pool wisdom for mutual benefit; to profit from widespread suggestions
understood by everyone (idiom); well known; a household name
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations; to sell one's soul for gain
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty; never satisfied with what one has
to see what is right and act courageously (idiom, from Analects); to stand up bravely for the truth; acting heroically in a just cause
the quick-footed climb up first (idiom); the early bird catches the worm; first come, first served
with keen interest pleasure (idiom); with gusto; to relish; eagerly; with great interest
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma; trapped; in an impossible situation
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma; trapped; in an impossible situation
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
to think of danger in times of safety; to be vigilant in peacetime (idiom)
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to raise one and infer three; to deduce many things from one case (idiom)
to play a critical role (idiom); influential
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending; to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money; to give generously to charity
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering; hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
duplicity; hypocrisy (idiom)
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
appealing to the masses; universally appreciated (idiom)
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products; to masquerade as having an ability; token member of a group
an old horse knows the way (idiom); an experienced worker knows what to do; an old hand knows the ropes
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side; to have the courage of one's convictions; just and forceful
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish; the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
use all efforts to make the country prosperous; hard work
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom); to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty; to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about; displaced

to be in a sorry state; to be utterly defeated
continuously; in an endless stream (idiom)
to return from a rewarding journey
unhurried; calm; composed; leisurely
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to steadily deteriorate
go down the drain; steadily deteriorate; see 每况愈下
nothing remains the same (idiom); change beyond recognition
openly and without fear; brazenly
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom); to put one's own safety before matters of principle
deliberate violation (idiom); intentional crime
hidebound by convention (idiom)
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters; condescending; to go about with one's nose in the air
to overreach oneself / to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face; to backfire; see 弄巧成拙
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat; to burn one's boats
everybody celebrating together; universal celebration; universal rejoicing
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom); imminent peril; a matter of life or death
thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive; once you've seen one, you've seen them all
extremely rare (idiom); once in a blue moon
lessons from the past; lessons drawn from others' mistakes
imperceptible influence; to influence secretly
to twist words and force logic (idiom); sophistry; loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument; shoving false arguments down people's throats
the students surpass the teacher
to lose a family fortune (idiom)
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers; deep friendship; closely attached to one another
more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
to say what everyone says (idiom); to conform to what one perceives to be the majority view; to follow the herd
to work hard without complaint (idiom)
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
riches and honour; luxurious
like wildfire (idiom); unstoppable
as if relieved from a burden (idiom); to have a weight off one's mind
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom); fig. not enough to go around; demand exceeds supply
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom); fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people; altruism
half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results; a stitch in time saves nine
twice the effort for half the result
to view death as a return home; to not be afraid of dying; to face death with equanimity (idiom)
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom); fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped; reticent; not breathing a word
to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors; mutual help and protection

with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect

as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom); the truth comes to light

a common occurrence (idiom)
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt; flexible; to accept circumstances with good will
unceasing torrent (idiom); talking non-stop; gabbling forty to the dozen
mouth like a torrent (idiom); eloquent; glib; voluble; have the gift of the gab
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows; for better or for worse
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes; to take sb down with oneself; to end in mutual destruction
to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others

to seize every opportunity; to be full of tricks
to work to no avail (idiom)
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate

to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend; to kick a benefactor in the teeth
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor; evildoer; to perpetrate outrages

to moan about imaginary illness; fussing like a hypochondriac; fig. sentimental nonsense

discouraged; downhearted

(idiom) flourishing; thriving
to speak without thinking (idiom); to blurt sth out
to speak off the cuff; to casually opine
happy and excited (idiom); in high spirits; in great delight
to plan in advance (idiom); a card up one's sleeve; forewarned is forearmed
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life; realistic
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom); fig. to act in the nick of time

to get to the bottom of things; to inquire deeply into (idiom)

(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to live like a prince (idiom)
tottering; on the verge of collapse
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly; a crushing defeat; beaten and in a hopeless position
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom); plain sailing; to go smoothly; have a nice trip!
familiarity at first sight
one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
kill two birds with one stone
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse; ruined at a stroke; unable to recover after a minor hitch
to get sth done once and for all

stingy (idiom)
obvious at a glance (idiom); obvious at a glance (idiom)

to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
to have achieved nothing; to be a total failure; to get nowhere

obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom); willful; one's own way; dogmatic

to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
a tooth for a tooth (retaliation)
easy as a hand's turn (idiom); very easy; no effort at all
to imagine the wildest thing; to indulge in fantasy

more than one can attend to (idiom); deluged (with inquiries etc); overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)

to increase steadily; to grow with each passing day

becoming more prosperous with each passing day

high and mighty (idiom); arrogant

like-minded (idiom); fellow enthusiast; kindred spirit
to pay no heed to (idiom); to ignore; to brush aside

to contradict oneself; self-contradictory; inconsistent
